titleStmt.title: A warning for all lewd livers, by the example of a disobedient childe, who riotously wasted and consumed his fathers and mothers goods, and also his own, among strumpets, and other lewd livers, and after dyed most miserably on a dung-hill. To the tune of Sir Andrew Barton.
titleStmt.author: L. P. (Laurence Price), fl. 1625-1680?

publicationStmt.publisher: For Thomas Lambert, and are to be sold in Smithfield, at the Hospitall gate.,

notesStmt.note: Verse: "My bleeding heart with griefe and care ..."
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
